text: Kenneth Jerome Riley (August 6, 1947 â€“ June 7, 2020) was a professional American football cornerback. He was born in Bartow, Florida. Riley played his entire career for the Cincinnati Bengals, in the American Football League in 1969 and in the NFL from 1970 through 1983. In college, he played for the Florida A&M; Rattlers for Florida A&M; University. Riley died on June 7, 2020 of a heart attack at the age of 72.FAMU, NFL legend Ken Riley passes away ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American football cornerbacks Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Cincinnati Bengals players Category:Sportspeople from Florida
title: Ken Riley
